title: Humans of New York
content: He makes me want to know about little things, so that I can teach him. Like when we sit by this lake, I wish I knew what kind of turtle that was, so I could tell him. And I want to finger out what kind of duck that is, so I can tell him about it next time we come. What do you want most for him ? Whatever his dreams are, I’m down to ride for him. What’s your biggest fear for him ? That he won’t try. If he doesn’t try, I’ll be hurt. Cause then we’ll never know how far he’d get.

title: Reading to Learn the Art of Expression
content:
Reading to Learn the Art of Expression
When you read a short story, you may read it merely for pleasure.
When you read a biographical sketch, you may read it merely for information. But as you are a learner of English, I think you should often read to learn the art of expression. And for this purpose you may read either a short story or a biographical sketch, either an essay or a news item, indeed, anything that is written in good current English. Even from a short paragraph, you may learn several forms of expression if you are observant enough. Try to read the following paragraphs from BBC Mcdern English and notice the points of usage listed below;
Over 100 years ago she opened the first British hospital for women. There are still very few of these hospitals in England. This hospital is in Euston Road in London. Its situation means that women from all over England can reach it quite easily. Her aim when she opened the hospital was to provide a place where women could go and receive treatment from female doctors and nurses; She also wanted the hospital to provide jobs for female doctors at a time when it was very difficult for them to find work. Recently the authorities have tried to close the hospital. They say that it is old-fashioned and wastes a lot of money. However, the Government has decided that the hospital will stay open.
Many peple feel very glad that the valuable service offered by this hospital will continue.
 “Over” More than. “in Euston Road” “in … Road”. “means that …” “Means” takes an object clause introduced by “that”. “from all over England” “all over England” “from all over England”. “receive treatment”. Patients receive treatment. “wanted the hospital to provide…” “We want them to do it”. “at a time when …” “at a time when …” “Recently the authorities have tried.” The present perfect is here used with “recently”. “the Government has” “the Government” can be considered singular. “decided that …” “Decide(d)” takes an object clause introduced by “that”. “stay open”. “Stay” can be a copulative verb.  In this way you will learn the art of expression very quickly; perhaps one or two paragraphs a day will teach you hundreds of forms of expression in a month, and these forms of expression will greatly improve your writing.
And if you can - I believe you can - commit to memory one or two paragraphs a day that you have already read in this way, the results will be still greater;

title: Let Him Go Olivia
content:
Let Him Go, Olivia
Alejandro Arbide, San Antonio, Texas.
There I was. Upside down inside the swimming pool. Drowned.
My parents were screaming.
It must have been the summer of ‘63.
It was a gloomy day. Every Sunday we went to my grandparents’ house.
My cousins and I were playing alongside the pool. I must have slipped.
At three years old, I did not know how to swim.
My mother was giving me CPR. More than twenty or twenty-five minutes had gone by. The ambulance had arrived.
Everybody was staring at my mother.
“Let him go, Olivia. It’s over.” Even my father had some feelings of resignation.
Yet, she never gave up.
I write this story as a tribute to my mother, who, only four years later, passed away.
And also in recognition of editors who made it possible for my mother to have read in Reader’s Digest the miracle made by another woman utilizing then recently discovered CPR.

title: Readme
content:
形容词 then 用法详解     核心概念     这里的 then 不是副词“然后”，而是形容词“当时的”。
原句分析      原短语： then recently discovered CPR 字面意思： “在当时那个时间点，新近被发现的心肺复苏术” 结构： then（形容词） + recently discovered（复合形容词） + CPR（名词）  语法功能       时间锚定作用
then 将“新发现”的时间锁定在故事发生的过去时刻，而不是作者写作的现在时刻。
  双重时间限定
 recently discovered：相对于某个时间点“最近” then：明确指出这个时间点是故事中的1963年    拆解理解      Without then: 新近发现的CPR（可能指现在的新发现） With then: 在当时（1963年） 算是新近发现的CPR  同义转换      …utilizing CPR, which was, at that time, a recently discovered technique.
 常见类似结构        短语 含义     the then president 当时的总统   my then boyfriend 我当时的男朋友   the then popular theory 当时流行的理论   in the then capital 在当时的首都    记忆技巧     公式： then + 形容词短语/名词 = “当时的…”
检验方法： 可以在 then 位置换成 “at that time” 或 “at the time” 来理解：
 the then president → the president at that time then recently discovered → recently discovered at that time   在原故事中的具体作用     作者站在现在回忆1963年：
CPR在更早（50年代末）被研发，但对1963年的事件来说，它仍是“新”技术。
then 精准定位了这个“新”是相对于1963年，而不是写作的现在。

title: 01. A private conversation
content:
要求
  内化单词 + 语法 + 习惯用法。 听力 + 口语 + 写作练习     Bilibili
 1. 课文     Last week, I went to the theater. I had a very good seat.
The play was interesting. But I did not enjoy it.
A young man and a young woman were sitting behind me. They were talking loudly.
I got very angry. I could not hear the actors.
I turned around. I looked at the man and the woman, but they did not pay any attention.
In the end, I could not bear it.
I turned around again. “I can’t hear a word”, I said angrily.
“It’s none of your business.” the young man said. “This is a private conversion!”

 6. Asking questions.       As me if What/ When/ How … ? Is / Does …   7. 关键字复述      可根据句子结构(123456)， 提炼关键字， 并能 流利 复述文章。

title: 12. Goodbye and good luck
content:
要求
  内化单词 + 语法 + 习惯用法。 听力 + 口语 + 写作练习     Bilibili
 1. 课文     Our neighbour, Captain Charles Alison, will sail from Portsmouth tomorrow.
We’ll meet him at the harbour early in the morning.
He will be in his small boat, Topsail.
Topsail is a famous boat.
It has sailed across the Atlantic many times.
Capiton Alison will set out at eight o’clock, so we have plenty of time.
We’ll see his boat and then say goodbye to him.
He will be away for two months.
We’re very proud of him.
He will take part in an important race across the Atlantic.
4. Expression (常用表达)       每个 Expression 造句 5 个。 陈述句 + 一般疑问句 + 特殊疑问句。    sail from sw. set out / set off have plenty of time be away A be proud of sb-B and A let B down say goodbye to ... take part in  5. Comprehension (理解)      根据课文提问并回答
  Who is your neighbour?  Captain Charles Alison.   Where will he sail from tomorrow?  Portsmouth.    6. Asking questions.       Ask me if we’re very proud of our neighbour?
 Are you very proud of your neighbour? Who …? Who are you very proud of? How? How do you feel with your neighbour?    We’re very proud of our neighbour. (Who)
 Who are very proud of their neighbour? Who are you very proud of?    He’s called Captain Charles Alison? (What)
 What is he called?    7. 关键字复述      使用关键字， 能 流利 复述文章。
  neighbour, Alison - sail - tomorrow. meet - him - harbour - morning will be - boat, Topsail famous - boat has sailed - Atlantic - times Alison - set out - ? o’clock, so we - plenty of time. shall see ? - then - say goodbye. be away - months we - very proud. take part - important race - Atlantic  8. 翻译 / 复写。      使用翻译文章。 （中文）
 9. Topics for discussion      模仿 雅思问答结构: 结论 - 为什么？
 不会就先写中文。
    Can you name some famous sailors, and describe what they did?
  What do you think is the best way to cross the Atlantic?
  Why do you think people choose to cross the Atlantic alone?
